intro: Alinula paradoxa, commonly known as the paradoxical alinula, is a rare and lesser-known species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other related trees. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and distinctive, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Alinula paradoxa is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from habitat loss and deforestation.
